overview: A Community Care Grant can help you to live independently, or help if you and your family are under exceptional pressure - what you'll get, eligibility and applying.
title: Community Care Grants

table.body:
You could get a Community Care Grant if you need financial help and:

- you're homeless
- you've just left prison
- you care for someone
- you're facing family breakdown

You may also get it if you need financial help to:

- live independently in the community 
- ease exceptional pressure on you and your family

^You don't have to pay a Community Care Grant back^
table.title: Overview

table.body:
The amount you get depends on your circumstances.

##Effect of savings on awards##
The amount of Community Care Grant you may get is reduced if you have savings of:

- over £500 where you and your partner are aged under 60 
- over £1,000 where you and/or your partner are aged over 60 

##How Community Care Grants are paid##

All benefits, pensions and allowances are paid into an account, eg your bank account.
table.title: What you'll get

table.body:
You can apply if you're already getting, or likely to start getting either:

- Income Support
- income-related Employment and Support Allowance
- income-based Jobseeker's Allowance
- Pension Credit

You must also be:

- moving out of residential or institutional care to live independently 
- moving to a new home which will be more suitable for you following an unsettled period in your life and are being resettled by an organisation like a local council or voluntary organisation 
- needing help to stay in your home and not go into residential care or hospital 
- needing help because you and your family face exceptional pressure, such as family breakdown or because one of you has a long-term illness 
- looking after someone who is ill or disabled, or has been released from custody on temporary licence 
- needing help with expenses such as visiting someone who is ill, or to attend a relative's funeral

^You can't usually get a Community Care Grant if you've already asked for the same items or services in the last 28 days^
table.title: Eligibility

table.body:
##Download a Community Care Grant claim form##
The form comes with notes to help you fill it in and will also tell you where to send it when it's completed.

$D[Download 'Community Care Grant and Crisis Loan for items and services in the event of a disaster SF300' (PDF, 264KB)](http://www.dwp.gov.uk/advisers/claimforms/sf300_print.pdf "Community Care Grant claim form - SF300"){:rel="external"}$D

If you're still in residential or institutional care, you can apply up to 6 weeks before you leave.
table.title: How to claim

table.body:
##If you're unhappy with the decision on your application##
You have the right to ask for a review. You must [contact Jobcentre Plus](http://los.direct.gov.uk/default.aspx?type=2&lang=en "Contact Jobcentre Plus"){:rel="external"} within 28 days explaining why you think the decision was wrong and ask for it to be reviewed. 

If you're still unhappy with the outcome, you can ask for a further review by an independent Social Fund Inspector. The process should take no longer than 12 days.

$D[Download 'How to ask for an independent review' (PDF, 78KB)](http://www.irs-review.org.uk/infocent/leafbook/irs1/irs1.pdf/ "How to ask for an independent review"){:rel="external"}$D

The form comes with notes that will help you fill it in and tell you where to send it.

%The Social Fund Inspector's decision is final%
table.title: Further information
